intro: Godetia parviflora var. margaritae, commonly known as the Margarita godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink and white, often resembling miniature roses. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to both ornamental and ecological landscapes.
